page.title: 11Willoughby Station
page.content: The line of the Great Northern Railway runs almost N/S through the D block. Opened on 1/3/1848 it closed on 5/10/1970.During its life it fulfilled three functions; local mixed traffic, main link from Grimsby to London for the fish trade and connection between N.Midlands and S.Yorks conurbations and East Coast resorts of Mablethorpe and Skegness. Access to Mablethorpe was via the single track line that left Willoughby junction (its now a nature reserve owned by Lincs and S.Humberside Trust) and looped through Sutton on Sea to Mablethorpe, rejoining at Louth. During its heyday traffic was heavy in the summer with excursions from Nottingham, Derby and Sheffield running from early morning until midnight. Being a junction Willoughby was more important than Alford.
